item.title: A note on the Irrationality of $\zeta(5)$ and Higher Odd Zeta Values
item.description: arXiv:2407.07121v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note, we prove the irrationality of $\zeta(5)$ and generalise the method to prove irrationality of higher odd zeta values. Our proof relies on the method of contradiction and mathematical induction. For $n\geq 1$, we denote $d_n=\text{lcm}(1,2,...,n)$. In the first part of the article, we assume $\zeta(5)$ is rational, say $a/b$. Then we observe that for $n\geq b$, there exists a linear combination of $\zeta(5)$ with coefficients $d_n$ that has a solution. Later using existence of solution of Diophantine equation and induction, we show that such a linear combination of $\zeta(5)$ has no solution, which is a contradiction. In the second part, we generalise this method for all higher odd zeta values.
